# Diversity and Inclusion Badging

<img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/{CATEGORY}-Badging-passing?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64," height=72 />

This is the repository that houses documentation related to the {CATEGORY} Badging Project

The purpose of this repository is to serve as a "starting point" for the {CATEGORY} Badging Program

## Applying for Badges

Applications are conducted via the simple pull request workflow as follows:

1. An entry is appended to the README of the respective repository:
   - [{TYPE}(link)]()
   - [{TYPE}(link)]()
2. A pull request is opened to provide the details indicated in the respective template:
   - [{TYPE}(link)]()
   - [{TYPE}(link)]()

## Goal

The goal of the {CATEGORY} Badging Program is to encourage projects and events to obtain {CATEGORY} badges for reasons of pride, leadership, self-reflection, and self-improvement on issues critical to building the Internet as a social good.

Here are the primary deliverables of the {CATEGORY} Badging Program:

  * {DELIVERABLES}

## Badge Levels

Four statuses exist for the {CATEGORY} Badging Program:

| Level        | Badge        |  Requirements Met
|--------------|--------------|-------------------------------------
| Pending      | ![Pending]   |  0 to 2
| Passing      | ![Passing]   |  3
| Silver       | ![Silver]    |  4
| Gold         | ![Gold]      |  5

Each badge is made for a {TYPE} or a {TYPE}.
